author: PA News Agency
title: Security stepped up around Christmas celebrations in Germany and Austria | Gazette
text: Sightseeing visits have been barred at Germany’s landmark cathedral in Cologne and Christmas Eve worshippers face security checks to get into midnight Mass as police responded to indications of a potential attack. However, a top security official urged people not to shy away from holiday celebrations out of fear. Churchgoers attended multiple services at the cathedral despite the ban on visits purely for sightseeing, a day after police descended on the cathedral and searched it with sniffer dogs. With several dozen officers on duty outside, Auxiliary Bishop Rolf Steinhaeuser greeted those attending what he said was “probably the most secure church service in all of Germany”. In Austria, police said they also were stepping up security around Vienna’s churches and Christmas markets, apparently responding to the same intelligence about a potential threat. They did not give further information, but the dpa news agency reported without citing a source that the threat came from an Islamic extremist group. Police in Cologne said they were taking precautions over Christmas even though the information they had was for an attack on New Year’s Eve. “Even if the reference was to New Year’s Eve, there are a lot of people in the area around the cathedral, today is Christmas Eve midnight Mass, it is one of the most visited cathedrals, the main train station is nearby,” police spokesman Wolfgang Baldes said while standing in front of the cathedral. “There are a lot of people, and that’s why we said that if there was an indication, we would do everything necessary to protect people,” Mr Baldes added. Cathedral Provost Guido Assmann said in an interview on the Cologne Archdiocese website domradio.de that halting sightseeing visits did not represent a big change since such visits are normally not allowed during services anyway, and services were scheduled throughout the day on Sunday. Cologne’s towering cathedral, whose twin spires rise 515ft high, is a major tourist destination visited by some six million people a year. It is home to the Shrine of the Three Kings, a gold- and silver-decorated casket said to contain the relics of the three wise men described in the New Testament as paying homage to the newborn Jesus. Police and cathedral officials urged churchgoers planning to attend Mass on Sunday night to arrive early and not bring bags or purses. At the same time, Herbert Reul, interior minister for the state of North Rhine-Westphalia, appealed to the public not to stay away. “Caution is advised,” he said, but “we are not defenceless. Our agencies are using all available information to protect us as well as possible”. Mr Reul added: “My appeal is, go to church, celebrate Christmas. Fear is the currency of terrorists. We should not make it more valuable.” The European Union’s home affairs commissioner, Ylva Johansson, warned on December 5 that Europe faces a “huge risk of terrorist attacks” over the Christmas holidays due to fallout from the war between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. author: Glenn Marshall
title: WKND Warrior awning and rooftop tent combo is out now
text:
WKND Warrior awning and rooftop tent combo is out now Improve your touring set-up with this excellent pairing from WKND Warrior 6 Jan 2024, 09:00 am Share Facebook Twitter Email Copy Link Glenn Marshall Gallery 13 Buy now at WKND Warrior With the WKND Warrior 270 Awning and WKND Odin rooftop tent combo, your outdoor experiences are about to get even better. In a world where exploring the great outdoors has become a way of life, these two products have garnered attention for their exceptional design, functionality and versatility.
What distinguishes this WKND Warrior combo is its seamless compatibility, as the awning and rooftop tent are expertly designed to work together. Using the WKND 316 stainless steel brackets allows the awning to securely attach to the side of the rooftop tent.
Additionally, standard installation options are available for securely mounting the awning to your vehicle's roof rack. There is flexibility when it comes to mounting the rooftop tent, with the choice to mount it directly on to a platform rack, crossbars or canopy.
13 “ The Warrior 270 Awning and Odin rooftop tent are a dynamic duo , a perfect pairing that turns any camping trip into a well-coordinated outdoor masterpiece. Together, they redefine comfort and convenience in the wilderness,” said Kaedon Thiart, owner of WKND Warriors.
The rooftop Tent boasts a sleek and slim design, standing at only 170mm in height (excluding roof racks and solar panels), it is one of the slimmest rooftop tents available. Using robust 280gsm rip-stop polyester-cotton material with double-stitching and waterproofing, you're shielded from the elements, ensuring no seepage or mildew, even on rainy nights.
The tent comes equipped with anti-condensation mats at both the top and bottom, along with three access zippers to perfectly accommodate any touring setup. All of these features are encased in a durable honeycomb aluminium hard shell, providing excellent insulation against varying weather conditions.
Gear Guides Suspension Lights Canopies Bullbars Roof Racks Recovery Gear Storage Tools Camping Tents & Awnings 13 Other features include internal USB/USB-C charging points, six roof storage pockets, a 12V red/white LED strip light, and a 70mm high-density foam mattress. Weighing 65kg, this certainly is a lightweight rooftop tent. The internal sleeping space is 2050mm x 1220mm and the closed dimensions are 2100mm x 1340mm x 170mm, not taking into account the included 125W ultra-thin hard solar panel.
The awning is self-standing, with the externally braced design offering an advantage in maximising your usable shade compared to other 270-degree self-standing awnings. It includes a fold-up pole and features extended final arms and improved rear coverage. Made using the same polycotton as the RTT, the awning is lightweight with functional bracing designed to withstand high winds.
The Warrior 270 awning and WKND Odin rooftop tent combo offers an unbeatable combination of quality, functionality and convenience for only $5500. Buy now at WKND Warrior Glenn Marshall

author: @infoitinterno
title: Sciopero 29 novembre, per Valditara era immotivato: il 95% dei lavoratori è andato a scuola, qualcuno…
text:
Sciopero 29 novembre, per Valditara era immotivato: il 95% dei lavoratori è andato a scuola, qualcuno rifletta. Poi torna a parlare di immigrati
Articolo Precedente
Articolo Successivo
Sullo sciopero del comparto scuola del 29 novembre, proclamato da Cgil, Uil e sindacati di base contro i tagli e la mancanza di risorse per la scuola nella Manovra 2025, sebbene degli istituti siano rimasti chiusi e in alcune zone le adesioni abbiano toccato il 70%, per il ministro dell’Istruzione Giuseppe Valditara valgono i numeri ufficiali: questi, seppure parziali, dicono che gli scioperanti nella scuola si sono fermati al 5,66% Sono dati che “parlano da soli” ha esclamato il Ministro. [(Tecnica della Scuola)](https://www.tecnicadellascuola.it/sciopero-29-novembre-per-valditara-era-immotivato-il-95-dei-lavoratori-e-andato-a-scuola-qualcuno-rifletta-poi-torna-a-precisare-di-immigrati)
Ne parlano anche altre testate
Sciopero scuola: adesione al 5,65%, dati MIM. Valditara: “Adesione molto bassa, avanti con le riforme”. Cgil e Uil: “Ribadiamo le ragioni della nostra mobilitazione” Di Le due confederazioni sindacali ribadiscono le ragioni della mobilitazione, sottolineando come la legge di bilancio non risponda alle esigenze del paese e dei cittadini. [(Orizzonte Scuola)](https://www.orizzontescuola.it/sciopero-scuola-adesione-al-565-dati-mim-cgil-e-uil-ribadiamo-le-ragioni-della-nostra-mobilitazione/)
Si è tenuto oggi lo sciopero che ha coinvolto tutti i settori pubblici e privati, protestando contro la Manovra Finanziaria che si appresta ad essere approvata entro la fine di dicembre. [(Scuolainforma)](https://www.scuolainforma.news/sciopero-scuola-29-novembre-adesione-ancora-bassa-non-e-stato-superato-il-6-soddisfatto-il-ministro-valditara/)
Oltre a questo, un’adesione complessiva al 70%, una discreta lista di aziende che hanno raggiunto il 100% e comunque punte molto alte in diverse realtà produttive del Paese, … [(Il Fatto Quotidiano)](https://www.ilfattoquotidiano.it/in-edicola/articoli/2024/11/30/sciopero-generale-cgil-uil-cantano-vittoria-adesioni/7786527/)
Riceviamo e pubblichiamo una riflessione sullo sciopero di oggi, 29 novembre, a cura del sindacalista della Cgil Scuola, Pippo Frisone [(LegnanoNews.com)](https://www.legnanonews.com/aree-geografiche/legnano/2024/11/29/sciopero-generale-cgil-scuola-legnano-basta-tagli-e-classi-pollaio/1264299/)
In realtà, tracciando un bilancio a fine giornata, le dichiarazioni di giubilo pronunciate dai due leader sindacali Landini e Bombardieri sembrerebbero un po' scontrarsi con la verità numerica dei fatti. [(il Giornale)](https://www.ilgiornale.it/news/interni/adesione-solo-5-ecco-i-numeri-flop-dello-sciopero-generale-2405098.html)
Scuola, sanità, trasporti (quest'ultimo oggetto di precettazione da parte del Ministro Salvini, non senza polemiche): questi i settori per cui è previsto lo stop nella giornata odierna.E dalle 9.30, come previsto, Corso Vittorio Emanuele nel capoluogo molisano si è riempito di sindacalisti e manifestanti (tra cui anche i pensionati dello SPI-CGIL), un centinaio con la pioggia che probabilmente ha rovinato un po' i piani. [(Primonumero)](https://www.primonumero.it/2024/11/e-il-giorno-dello-sciopero-generale-sindacati-e-manifestanti-in-piazza-sotto-la-pioggia/1530841827/)

author: @newscientist
title: Global sea ice levels just hit a new record low
text:
There was less sea ice covering the oceans in February of this year than at any other point on record, according to satellite measurements from the European Union’s climate service Copernicus.
“One of the consequences of a warmer world is melting sea ice, and the record or near-record low sea ice cover at both poles has pushed global sea ice cover to an all-time minimum,” said Samantha Burgess at the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts in a statement. Global average temperatures in February of this year rose 1.59°C above the pre-industrial average, making it the third-warmest February on record, according to the service.
Advertisement
These high temperatures impacted the global sea ice extent, which includes both the Arctic, where sea ice is currently near its annual maximum, and the Antarctic. The satellite record for both regions extends back to 1979.
In the Arctic, sea ice remained at 8 per cent below average throughout February, missing an area of ice roughly the size of the UK. This was the third consecutive month to set a new monthly record low in the Arctic.
This decline in the northern hemisphere has combined with a longer-term decline in Antarctic sea ice, seen over the past two years. Although Antarctic sea ice seemed to recover to near average levels in December of last year, it then rapidly declined again. In February, the ice reached its fourth-lowest extent on record for the month, remaining 26 per cent below average.
Sign up to our The Earth Edition newsletter
Unmissable news about our planet delivered straight to your inbox every month.
The record low ice in both hemispheres is “cause for serious concern”, said Robert Larter at the British Antarctic Survey in a statement. He says the lack of ice will harm polar ecosystems and expose ice shelves to more ocean water, which could accelerate melting and sea level rise.
The missing ice also has an effect beyond the poles: less ice means less solar radiation will be reflected to space, adding to warming. It also could weaken global ocean currents that depend on the dense, salty water produced when sea ice forms.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: City sanitation workers, Nash County DSS, July tornado dominated headlines in 2023
text: Throughout much of the year, a pair of tragedies in the Twin Counties made headlines as local leaders and area residents responded to each crisis in different ways. An effort led by city sanitation workers seeking fairer pay also received much attention in 2023. In covering the stories that had the biggest impact on Telegram readers, how the community responds to conflict and crisis seemed to be an undercurrent in a year of great challenges for those who live and work in the Twin Counties. The Telegram newsroom convened recently and voted on the top 10 stories of the year. In today’s edition, we recap four of those stories that we consider to be among the biggest stories of 2023. In our weekend edition, we will reveal the story we consider to be the top story of the year. No. 4. Sanitation workers call for fair pay raises The issue of whether city employees, mainly sanitation workers, are being paid enough took center stage in the public arena of municipal government in 2023. However, activists and residents calling for action, including at the speaker’s podium at City Council meetings and at an Oct. 10 rally outside City Hall, have faced a lack of a supportive majority on the council. Additionally, city Human Resources Director Kena Cofield Jones, at a Sept. 11 council work session, showed that, except for a superintendent, 44 of 45 sanitation workers received a pay raise, with the ranges of those raises being from 5 percent to 24 percent. This was ranked the fourth biggest story of the year in a top 10 list of stories as chosen by the Telegram. The matter of city employees seeking fairer pay can be traced to when City Manager Keith Rogers Jr., in a news release on April 14, announced he had given the go-ahead to raise the starting pay of city police officers to $60,000. Rogers on May 17 submitted a proposed municipal operating budget that also called for allocating necessary funds to implement recommendations from a classification and compensation study in connection with city employee pay. The study called for increasing the minimum wage from $15 an hour to $16.83 an hour and creating market-driven competitive pay grades. Rogers said that this would include the average salary of a firefighter or emergency medical technician going up to $54,944 and the average salary of a police officer going up to $60,000. On June 26, before a majority of the City Council voted to approve the budget and the classification and compensation study, Councilman Andre Knight made a motion for an amendment to implement a 15 percent pay increase for public works employees as well as parks and recreation employees and to implement a 6 percent cost-of-living adjustment for full-time city employees, except those in the police department. The proposed amendment was nixed in a 4-3 vote. Knight continued to try to seek action on his calls for the pay increase and the cost-of-living adjustment, but in October and November council meetings, the same 4-3 majority batted down the measure in procedural moves that blocked further discussion of the issue. No. 3. State takes over Nash DSS after child deaths The story that ranked third in the top 10 list as chosen by the Telegram was the end of Amy Pridgen-Hamlett’s directorship of the Nash County Department of Social Services amid public outcries of negligence and incompetence. Nash County Commissioner Gwen Wilkins called for Pridgen-Hamlett to resign, and county officials on Sept. 28 were told Sarah Bradshaw of Vanguard Professional Staffing of Wilson was stepping in as interim DSS director. Earlier in the year, the Child Protective Services division of the Nash County DSS was taken over by the N.C. Department of Health and Human Services. State officials had deemed that leadership at the county office was unable to correct the problems of negligence and lack of supervisory oversight on their own. The trouble began with the death of 8-year-old Christal Lane of rural Nash County on Feb. 7, allegedly because of fatal brutality by her grandmother Patricia Ricks. Further revelations showed that on Dec. 19, 2022, DSS and law enforcement officials had been called to Coopers Elementary School to investigate injuries to Lane that were the result of a beating. Despite a recommendation by a Nash County sheriff’s deputy that Lane be removed from the home she had shared with her siblings and Ricks, DSS allowed Lane to return to the residence. In July, media reports said that another child, nearly 2-year-old Chase Hilliard, died in 2020 of complications resulting from non-accidental head injuries, with his mother, Vonquetta Hilliard, allegedly to blame and with DSS having failed to remove the child when the mother was unable to take care of him. Nash County Health Director Bill Hill, in an update Dec. 21 about the leadership at DSS, said that Bradshaw stayed on as interim DSS director for a couple months. Hill said that another person contracted through Vanguard, Suzanne Gray, came aboard on Oct. 19 to serve as interim DSS director after Bradshaw had to step away for personal reasons. Hill said that Pridgen-Hamlett transferred and has been working at a county health department facility on the UNC Health Nash campus. Hill said his information is that Pridgen-Hamlett has tendered paperwork to retire in January. No. 2. Tornado strikes Pfizer, several residences Number two in the top 10 stories in 2023 as chosen by the Telegram was the EF-3 tornado that on July 19 struck parts of Rocky Mount and the northern part of Nash and Edgecombe counties. Generally, an EF-3 is the fourth strongest type of tornado on a scale of six. The twister caused massive damage to pharmaceuticals giant Pfizer’s plant off North Wesleyan Boulevard and adjacent to the interchange with N.C. 4. The Belmont Lake Preserve, which is a residential area in the northern part of the city, also received major damage. After a news conference on July 21 under a tent just outside Pfizer, company Chairman and CEO Dr. Albert Bourla said, “We are here to stay, and we are here to make this plant once more the great plant it was — very quickly.” Prior to the tornado, a total of more than 3,200 colleagues and contractors had been working at the plant. During the news conference, Bourla also said Pfizer was committed to paying all the employees throughout the closure of the plant, regardless of whether they worked. On July 23, Gov. Roy Cooper went to the rural northern parts of Nash and Edgecombe counties to see the damage firsthand and, at one stop along the way, said that the people affected by the storm did the right things. The community’s recovery from the tornado has been powered by volunteers and led by nonprofit organizations and faith-based ministries. The United Way Tar River Region has acted as the backbone organization in directing financial aid and leading the region’s tornado recovery committee. As is a common refrain in the Twin Counties, in times of great need, the collaboration among various groups and organizations that have jumped into action has been unparalleled. The committee gave regular reports of how volunteers have helped clean up, cut down, repair, rebuild, rehome and provide hope to those affected by the tornado. Subscribe to the Rocky Mount Telegram

author: 睿见Economy
title: 屠光绍：AI在金融领域运用冷热不均，发展不平衡_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
股市瞬息万变，投资难以决策？来#A股参谋部#超话聊一聊， [点击进入]
专题：2025陆家嘴论坛召开，央行、金融监管总局、证监会等发布重磅政策
　　2025 陆家嘴 论坛于6月18日至19日在上海召开，主题为“全球经济变局中的金融开放合作与高质量发展”。上海新金融研究院理事长、上海交通大学上海高级金融学院创院理事长屠光绍出席并演讲。
　　屠光绍表示，AI在金融领域运用可以用四句话总结：冷热相交织；发展不平衡；挑战与机遇并存；发展与规范并重。
　　他具体谈到了四个方面。第一，现在金融机构、金融行业作为AI在金融领域运用的主体，从这个方面来观察，越来越多的金融机构，都开始在涉足AI领域，利用AI更好的为业务、为发展、为创新、为管理赋能。但热中有冷，从主体金融机构来看，各个行业运用AI的状况不是那么平衡。
　　第二，金融机构运用AI赋能金融机构发展，在具体的AI技术运用方面，有冷热不均的问题。比如聊天 机器人 在金融机构很普遍，但贴身助手并没有取得长足进步。
　　第三个，金融机构在运用业务范围方面越来越从简单业务到复杂业务，从内部管理到对外市场拓展，也包括比较简单的场景到复杂场景。屠光绍指出，AI目前刚刚起步，有些金融机构的核心业务运用并不是非常广泛，涉及到AI技术以及和金融的特性相结合方面，还需要进一步探索。
　　第四个，AI在金融运用有了初步的生态体系，但远远不够。屠光绍表示，这里涉及到制度、法规、监管方式、专业服务、其他科技公司、平台公司，还有更深层次的基础设施方面，包括数据质量等等。
　　屠光绍认为，AI的机遇在于它广泛运用到金融行业各个方面，会给整个金融行业，带来很多发展机遇，提升金融机构的竞争能力。但同时又有很多挑战，包括技术方面的挑战，此外也会影响金融行业要求。
　　“金融行业是外部性非常强的系统性非常强的，防范风险要求非常高，所以技术运用必须技术相对成熟。”他说，另外AI还会对金融机构带来安全隐私和核心人才的挑战。
　　谈及发展与规范并重，屠光绍称首先要发展，AI在金融体系里的运用，会使金融机构的形态、金融行业业态、金融体系的生态发生巨大的变化，通过积极发展它，最后才能提升整个金融体系能力，深化功能，提升服务能力。另外一方面，必须加强规范，这对金融体系的再造，提升金融体系的韧性和能力也至关重要。
　　新浪声明：所有会议实录均为现场速记整理，未经演讲者审阅，新浪网登载此文出于传递更多信息之目的，并不意味着赞同其观点或证实其描述。
